item.title: Dell introduces new laptops and monitors
item.description: Dell Singapore has launched new laptops and a monitor for consumers. The XPS 12 is the first 2-in-1 laptop with a 4K Ultra HD display. The Inspiron 11 3000 series offers an affordable and portable laptop option available in three colors. Dell also released their first 4K consumer monitor, the Dell 28 Ultra HD 4K Monitor. “Consumers have increasingly diverse needs. Whether it’s a student or a professional, size, power, design, and price all matter.

item.title: LG will be showcasing its newest Ultra monitors at CES
item.description: At CES, LG Electronics (LG) will showcase its newest Ultra monitors, featuring UltraWide models for productivity and UltraGear monitors designed for gaming. 2019 LG UltraWide Monitor Source: LG. The new 49" UltraWide monitor. Known for its innovation in the UltraWide monitor market, LG’s latest 49-inch model (49WL95) offers a 32:9 aspect ratio curved screen designed to enhance productivity. Its size is equivalent to two 27-inch Quad High Definition displays combined, with a resolution of 5,120 x 1,440 and 108 pixels per inch for clarity.

item.title: Actxa Spur makes training in your heart rate zone easier
item.description: Actxa has launched the Spur, a wearable fitness tracker that continuously monitors heart rate and provides zone indication. The Spur aims to make heart rate zone training accessible to everyone, not just athletes, by offering a user-friendly alternative to chest straps. For years, fitness enthusiasts and athletes have used heart rate as a measure of workout intensity. A higher heart rate generally indicates a more intense workout. The Spur uses a wrist-based sensor to measure resting heart rate and track different heart rate zones: Warm Up, Fat Burning, Cardio, Intense, and Maximum.

item.title: Dell introduces an improved range of PCs for both consumer and commercial markets
item.description: Dell debuted groundbreaking personal computing innovations at the annual Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in the US. They also updated their XPS, Inspiron, and Alienware consumer lines. Their OptiPlex, Latitude, and Precision commercial products received upgrades to 7th Gen Intel Core processors, USB-C with Thunderbolt 3 connectivity, and new professional graphics from NVIDIA and AMD. Dell’s monitor lineup also saw a refresh. The new Dell PC portfolio is equipped with Windows 10 and 7th Gen Intel Core processors, designed to maximize user productivity and creativity.

item.title: Dell creates business solutions to meet the needs of modern workplaces
item.description: The new Latitude series blends elegant design with enterprise-grade security, manageability, and dependability. The Vostro line offers a balance of performance and style for small businesses. Redesigned Precision workstations provide sleek, new choices for creative professionals. OptiPlex business PCs have become more compact, faster, and more energy-efficient. New Dell printing solutions grant one-stop access to various cloud-based services. Rakesh Mandal, Director and GM of Client Solutions for South Asia & Korea at Dell, highlighted the company’s dedication to providing state-of-the-art products developed using user insights.

item.title: Asus introduces a portable LED projector with a 4K display
item.description: The PB287Q is a 28-inch monitor with 4K ultra high definition. At CES last week, Asus, known for its consumer notebooks and motherboards, introduced new products designed for content creators and mobile professionals seeking enhanced performance and affordability. The company emphasized delivering bigger, better, and faster solutions. Among their offerings is the PB287Q, a 28-inch display with 4K ultra high definition (UHD) resolution. This slim-profile monitor features a full range of adjustments including swivel, tilt, pivot, and height, along with Splendid Plus video intelligence technology for optimal viewing comfort.

item.title: Travellers are pleased to engage with hotels on social media
item.description: A 2014 study by Accorhotels called the Social Media Monitor showed that hotels have a significant opportunity to connect with travelers on social media. In the Asia Pacific region, almost half of travelers follow hotel brands, more than airlines or other travel-related businesses. This trend is especially strong among travelers from China and Indonesia, as well as those between 25 and 44 years old. Interestingly, in countries with prominent airlines such as Malaysia, Australia, New Zealand, and Japan, airlines are followed most on social media.
